{"step_by_step_thinking": "Hypoalbuminemia refers to low levels of albumin in the blood. Albumin is a protein made by the liver that helps keep fluid in your bloodstream so it doesn't leak into other tissues. It is also carries various substances throughout your body, including hormones, vitamins, and enzymes. In the context of gastric cancer, hypoalbuminemia could be a result of malnutrition, inflammation, or liver disease, which are common in cancer patients.
